page.title: 05WINTERTON SHOW
page.content: The Winterton show is an annual event which began in 1872. The show began when farming people started to breed cattle and wanted to see who had the best. It really began just as competing but years from then it has turned into a family outing with fairs, side stalls etc. Farmers still bring their cattle to compete although not as many. Pigs and cows are banned in case of any disease. The horse jumping soon started in 1874 but in those days it was called leaping horses. The winner would get Â£5 which was a lot of money then. In 1926 horse jumping was introduced world wide by the British Horse Jumping Association. They used to put special trains on. They used to get off at Appleby and walk to Winterton which is about 4 miles.
